article.title: Fourteen Firms to Support Warfighter Cyber Operations
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Advanced C4 Solutions Incorporated, Tampa, Florida; ISHPI Information Technologies Incorporated, Mount Pleasant, South Carolina; Sentek Consulting Incorporated, doing business as Sentek Global, San Diego, California; ALEX-AS Joint Venture, Chantilly, Virginia; Strategic Operational Solutions Incorporated, Vienna, Virginia; HighAction LLC, Arlington, Virginia; Business Computers Management Consulting Group LLC, Falls Church, Virginia; Imagine One StraCon Venture LLC, Fort Worth, Texas; WIJET LLC, Huntsville, Alabama; Business Integra Technology Solutions Incorporated, Greenbelt, Maryland; Network Security Systems Plus Incorporated, Falls Church, Virginia; Dynamic Network Enterprises Incorporated, Stafford, Virginia; RLM Communications Incorporated, Spring Lake, North Carolina; and TISTA Science and Technology Corporation, Rockville, Maryland, are each being awarded an indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity, cost-plus-fixed-fee, performance-based, multiple award contract, with provisions for fixed-price-incentive and firm-fixed-price orders, to provide command, control, communications, computers, combat systems, intelligence, surveillance, reconnaissance electronics and communications services and solutions in support of mission capabilities within the integrated cyber operations portfolio to deliver the capabilities to operate, secure and defend the network and data in support of the warfighter's mission. These contracts include options, which, if exercised, would bring the cumulative value of these multiple award contracts to an estimated combined value of $98,700,000. These 14 contractors may compete for the task orders under the terms and conditions of the awarded contracts. The Space and Naval Warfare Systems Center Atlantic, Charleston, South Carolina, is the contracting activity.
